Data Scientist  Hearst Newspapers is looking for a Data Scientist to join our Data Technology team. The Data Scientist will be responsible for communicating and strategizing with the Business Intelligence group, Marketing and other stakeholders within the organization, and be open-minded and eager to democratize data science within the organization. They will work with Data Tech leadership to leverage various ML technologies already being implemented, including AutoML, Big Query ML, Data Robot, TensorFlow, etc… As well as help with the implementation of Data Science Lifecycle tools such as MLFlow. They will have previous experience with both Deep Learning and more traditional Machine Learning projects and be able to juxtapose use cases for both. We’re looking for a creative, out-of-the-box thinker who will from time to time bubble up ideas to the business and not just execute what is being handed down. Qualifications Experience working with Business Analyst BI and Data Engineering teams with a focus on time series data and fulfilling marketing objectives related to churn and revenue  Successful implementation of both Deep Learning and traditional Machine Learning on production past production projects  Successful implementation of a content recommendation system  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Ability to take complex mathematical models and machine learning concepts and make them clear to understand to colleagues outside the Data Science discipline  Ability to use creativity to find trends and distill patterns in big data  Proven ability to objectively consider and qualify best approach for a requirement given a wide range of predictive modeling techniques including Machine Learning, Deep Learning/Neural Networks, ML as a Service and AutoML techniques.  General Cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP) experience is a required GCP (Google Cloud Platform) experience preferred Ability to apply higher maths related to the Data Science discipline (advanced Calculus, Linear Algebra and advanced statical theory)  Advanced knowledge of programming languages related to Data Science work including SQL, Python and R.   Knowledge of related popular programming libraries, tools and paradigms such as TensorFlow 2, Keras and Sci-Kit Learn, Jupyter Notebooks, PyCharm.  Experience with Data Science lifecycle management tools such as MLFlow a plus  Advanced data visualization skills preferred  Understanding of Data Warehouse structure, design philosophy and query optimization techniques/consideration with hands-on experience with at least one leading Data Warehouse product such as Google Big Query, Amazon RedShift, Snowflake, etc..  Out of the box and “beyond the textbook” creative thinker  Understanding of Extract Transform Load and Extract Load Transform concepts with hands-on experience working with data transform tools preferred Responsibilities Will help develop and implement best practices for data collecting, data mining, data cleaning and data modeling  Evangelize use of Data Science within the organization  May collaborate with other divisions within the corporation and be able to contrast methodologies and best practices against business needs to selectively adopt and unify techniques  Work hands-on with Marketing, Business Intelligence, Business Analytics, Data Engineering and Software Engineering teams within the organization to fulfill requests and identify predictive modeling opportunities  Implement experiments and models to fulfill and when appropriate, diplomatically challenge requirements; be willing to always be looking for opportunity and willing to bubble up ideas  Be willing to respectfully work with other Data Scientists on the team, welcome debate and challenges to your proposed approaches by peers  Understand the importance of presentation and communication with teams and the unique comprehension ability, time constraints and needs of each cohort. Be capable of tuning the complexity and scope of presentations to the audience's needs. Be willing to accept critique and defend position among diverse groups including non-technical colleagues Be able to juxtapose Machine Learning and Deep Learning approaches to problems without biased towards implementation (traditional Python, R implementations vs ML cloud service offerings, vs AutoML tools) Maintain proficiency in the Data Science domain by keeping current on trends and informing supervisors and team members on new developments and changes. Will work with other teams to help diversify Data Science within the organization, including finding and helping define the boundaries for appropriate use cases for AutoML and other abstract applications not requiring a full Data Science discipline. Provide guidance, training and mentoring The successful candidate must have the following attributes: Advanced knowledge of SQL Extensive experience working with tabular and time-series data Google Cloud Platform experience (strongly desired) Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Team player Passion for Data Science and a desire to evangelize and democratize use of machine learning across a spectrum of use cases from marketing, BI and engineering Ability to remain highly motivated, self-starter Comfortable preparing presentations of work and presenting to both very large and small audiences Ability to adapt methodology used to the time constraints of the business on a project by project basis Bachelors of Science, Masters or PHD in a related field of Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Data Science or Statistics 4-6 years experience in the industry (may include graduate or postgraduate work) As part of its continued efforts to maintain a safe workplace for employees, Hearst Newspapers requires that all employees who receive a written offer of employment on or after November 12, 2021, be fully vaccinated (as defined by the CDC) against the coronavirus by the first day of employment as a condition of employment, to the extent permitted by applicable law. Your field of responsibility This is an exciting opportunity to join us as a Machine Learning Engineer in the core Finance One team within our CFO Tech IT organization. The team is at an innovative of scalable AI/ML with a number of machine learning models running in production. In this role, one will deploy high performance machine learning solutions into production using groundbreaking ML and Big Data technology. One will need to understand business requirements and convert them to a functioning data science pipeline with special emphasis on ensuring that the model can scale to large data volumes. One will be involved in end to end ML projects, starting from smaller scale POCs all the way to full scale ML pipelines in production. One will also have the opportunity to learn a variety of new tools, languages and libraries to keep up with constantly evolving innovative machine learning and data engineering. Above all, interested applicants must be dedicated, have a passion for technology and support multiple teams, products and requirements.   Your future colleagues  Finance One (F1) is a strategic big data platform providing a single, complete, consistent and harmonized repository of data for the CFO organization. We the F1 team, truly believe everyone should be able to apply the power of big data for their analytical needs and strive to enable this by eliminating the challenges teams within the bank face in adopting a big data technology stack. The team implements powerful scalable machine learning solutions which act on extensive data volumes. We have a variety of working ML models in production involving classification, anomaly detection, time-series forecasting, etc. and are looking for a highly energetic and motivated machine learning engineer to join us in working on the range of exciting projects we have to offer We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values  Your skills and experience  The applicant must have proven experience of 2+ years as a hands-on Data Scientist/ ML Engineer working on deploying Machine Learning solutions on Production systems. Advanced degrees in relevant fields may be considered as an alternative to a fraction of this experience.  Proven experience with big data tools like Spark/ PySpark, HDFS, Hive, Impala and Kudu.  Advanced knowledge of Scala, Python, Java, Bash (at least one is essential).  Detailed knowledge of machine learning libraries like scikit-learn, caret, h2o.  Knowledge of data transformation packages like pandas, numpy and dplyr.  Sound theoretical and detailed understanding of most common machine learning (clustering, classification, regression, anomaly detection, etc.) algorithms.  Advanced working SQL knowledge and proven experience working with relational databases and query authoring (SQL)  Excellent attention to detail and communication/presentation skills  Experience in working in a highly collegial environment with heavy emphasis on teamwork  Dedication to fostering an inclusive culture and value varied perspectives.   Nice to Have:  Knowledge of Spark MLlib, Sparkling Water, Pysparkling.  Knowledge of NLP algorithms and packages like spacy and nltk.  Experience with deep learning libraries like tensorflow, keras and pytorch.  Experience in building apps with Dash and Flask.  Exposure to public cloud platforms (Azure preferred).  Detailed understanding of Git, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes.  Experience in working in Agile scrum methodology.   Your new employer Find a new home for your skills, ideas, and ambitions. Company Description Etsy is the global marketplace for unique and creative goods. We build, power, and evolve the tools and technologies that connect entrepreneurs with buyers around the world. Etsy, Inc.'s 'house of brands' portfolio has expanded to now include four individually distinct ecommerce brands - Etsy, fashion resale marketplace Depop, musical instrument marketplace Reverb, and Brazil-based handmade goods marketplace Elo7. As an Etsy employee, you'll tackle unique problems alongside talented coworkers committed to Keeping Commerce Human. We're large enough that you'll focus on meaningful, complex challenges, but small enough that you can make a rewarding impact.   Job Description Data scientists at Etsy use rigorous methods to generate insights that inform product, engineering, and business decisions across the company. We collaborate with partner teams through all stages of development: actively uncovering opportunity areas, crafting experiments to test hypotheses, analyzing the impact of our efforts, and highlighting takeaways. Learning new skills and techniques is not only a requirement but a perk of the job! We are always looking for opportunities to grow. Our mission is to guide our partner teams with data and insights and tell the story of how we attract and retain our users — to teams, to senior management, and to the community. In this role, you would partner closely with our ReEngage team, whose focus is bringing shoppers back to Etsy with rewarding and engaging experiences and items. This is a full-time position reporting to the Senior Manager. This person will be located in Brooklyn or we are considering remote candidates based in the US for this position. Etsy offers three different work modes to meet the variety of needs and preferences of our team: Flex mode for candidates who are comfortable traveling to an office location 2+ times per week, Remote mode, and Office-based mode. Learn more about our flexible work modes and vaccination policy here. About the Role  In this role you will: Transform raw data into impactful analysis characterized by strong data governance/documentation, rigorous techniques, and actionable recommendations. Partner with product, engineering, design teams; use behavioral and transactional data to shed light on our users and our product experience, identify areas for improvement, and drive decision-making. Identify impactful metrics to understand the performance of products, develop reporting dashboards to track progress, and ingrain these metrics into teams’ day-to-day decision-making. Lead experimentation, help teams set strong hypotheses, and deliver robust analysis of experiment results. Continually evaluate and refine your technical toolkit; teach what you learn to the team.   Qualifications  2-4 years experience in a data scientist or data analyst role in which you extracted meaning from big data sets with little engineering support. Understanding of the principles of A/B testing, and experience crafting and analyzing experiments. Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with either R or Python. Bonus points for experience with the Hadoop ecosystem or additional scripting languages (Scala, PHP, Ruby, etc.) Experience with Looker, Tableau, or other data visualization software is a plus. Desire to advance your technical skill set and to apply new methods to impactful questions. Ability to communicate your insights verbally, visually, and in writing, and care for the quality and integrity of your work. Ability to play a key role on a cross-functional team. Passion for subjects such as experimental design, data visualization, and statistical analysis techniques. Additional Information   What's Next  If you're interested in joining the team at Etsy, please send a coverletter and resume telling us why you'd be right for the position. As you'vehopefully seen already, Etsy is a place that values individuality andvariety. We don't want you to be like everyone else - we want you to belike you! So write to us and tell us what you're all about.   Our Promise  At Etsy, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace makesus a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company. Weencourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences toapply. Etsy is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on thebasis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexualorientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability,gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status,veteran status, or any other legally protected status. We will ensure thatindividuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations toparticipate in the job application and interview process, to performessential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges ofemployment. While Etsy supports visa sponsorship, sponsorship opportunitiesmay be limited to certain roles and skillsets.   For U.S. roles only:  Many Etsy roles are open to remote candidates, and you'll be able to identify which ones within the location header of each job description. We're open to remote hires from all U.S. states except Hawaii and Alaska. For candidates who will work remotely from Colorado, visit this link for information related to Colorado's Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

job_title: Data Scientist, Search Relevance and Recommendation
job_Description: We’re looking for a data scientist to join Pond5, the world’s most accessible marketplace of media assets video creators need to tell stories, share knowledge, and inspire audiences. You will be reporting to Pond5’s Director of Data Science and will serve as a key member of the Data Science team, responsible primarily for improving search relevance and ranking algorithms and making it easy for customers to discover the right footage, music, or other media types from our vast collections. You will face problems that will require you to research the state-of-the-art among existing solutions, and use the data science techniques/algorithms in your arsenal to come up with acceptable and implementable solutions. These problems will often be in the areas of natural language processing and understanding, computer vision, etc. but not limited to those. You will not only build proofs-of-concept but work with the product and engineering teams to help architect implementations that can run at scale. You will bring further transparency to our key area of focus - search relevance - by identifying and reporting on key performance indicators, isolating positive and negative trends, and developing evidence-backed insights that can guide decisions. Pond5 is a place where you will find mentorship and inspiration from experienced data scientists, engineers, and other senior executives. In return, it is expected that you take initiative in finding and solving problems. If you are creative, resourceful, collaborative, love to take ownership, and comfortable with a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you. This role is based in New York, where we are operating in a hybrid environment with voluntary in-person attendance. We are also open to highly qualified applicants from other locations. WHAT YOU’LL DO Put machine learning and deep learning techniques to use in solving various problems, e.g. content understanding, language understanding, recommendation features, supply/demand prediction, etc. Help build new/improved search ranking algorithms. Drive exploratory analysis to identify actionable opportunities to improve search algorithms and inform product enhancements. As necessary, engage in deep data analysis to explain product observations, user behavior, or test results and provide clear recommendations when possible. Build and maintain reports, as necessary, to understand/monitor the state search relevance and the health of the marketplace. Use a mixture of SQL, scripting (e.g. Python), and/or statistical tools to pull, clean, and analyze data sets from structured and unstructured data. Be the go-to person on relevant data stores, tables, and schemas and be confident in data design when building new data sets. Contribute to building a quantitative and data-based decision-making culture. WHO YOU ARE You have 3+ years of working experience in a quantitative role, preferably 1+ years in a data science role working with search engines, social networks, or e-commerce platforms that support natural language search. Although we are starting by targeting mid-level data scientists, we will be delighted to talk to more experienced candidates. You have training in and demonstrable hands-on experience with a variety of machine learning techniques, including unsupervised deep learning techniques used in applications within areas of NLP, computer vision, etc. You have experience in investigative data sleuthing and modeling (preferably using Python/notebook environments) and the ability to quickly build proofs-of-concept (POC) of a new idea. You are a strong SQL programmer, with experience navigating and cleaning messy data at scale. You have excellent communication and presentation skills. You are able to tell a story, using data, to teammates from different functions and experience levels. You have familiarity with some business intelligence/visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, or other), but when needed you can quickly generate visualizations with Excel or Python scripts to make a point. You have a combination of strong statistical background (including the significance of tests) and business judgment to inform product strategy. You have the ability to write, understand and debug code. Strong Python skills required. You have an investigative and analytical mind and minute attention to detail. You hold a post-graduate degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, analytics, or similar quantitative fields. Bonus:  You can demonstrate your past contributions in solving a real-life business problem using data science technics - from problem abstraction to POC to implementation of an application that is/was running, at scale, in production. BENEFITS An international team of 170 awesome people Competitive compensation and benefits - medical, dental, generous 401(k) matching, and beyond Daily lunch provided (if/when working from the office) Discounted content Part of Wealthfront's list of career-launching companies! Part of BuiltinNYC's Best Mid-Sized Companies to Work! A fun team and fast paced environment Learn new things every day! Pond5 is the world’s largest, most vibrant video-first content marketplace, providing filmmakers, creators, and producers of all kinds with the content, inspiration, and tools they need to improve their projects. As the only content marketplace that meaningfully shares licensing revenue with its contributing artists, Pond5 is driven by a commitment to its passionate and growing global community of more than 100,000 professional visual and audio creators, providing a platform where their creative work can flourish, and helping them to make a sustainable living. With groundbreaking features like visual search for video and integrations into all major video-editing software, Pond5 is innovating daily, making it easier to find and use the content that creatives need to bring their vision to life. Pond5 is a venture-backed company funded by Accel Partners and Stripes Group with offices in New York, Dublin, Prague, and London. Job Type: Full-time

We are looking for talented candidates who have a strong computer science background, i.e. thinking like a computer scientist where computational optimizations and innovations are applied every day, programming is not an afterthought. Candidates should not be hesitant to take on projects where he/she will everything end-to-end, thinking like an engineer not afraid to get his/her hands dirty and no job is too small or hard, with a core understanding of machine-learning is only a small portion of a project and majority of the projects will be engineering focused. The Digital Intelligence team's mission is to utilize large-scale computation, true large-scale data set, and apply machine-learning to our most critical and wide-range customer products. The number of products and practice areas is large and far-reaching, i.e. we work on products that are impactful to our millions and millions of customers and households. We work closely with our engineering and technology partners to deploy solutions to reach out customers. We value our customers' direct feedback and function in a truly agile way to incorporate changes to improve application experience. The candidate needs to have significant training and working experience in computer science, with a few years of hands-on applied machine-learning application development in advertisement placement for both digital and nondigital channels. The candidate needs to have significant software engineering work experience, where he/she has been responsible for bringing a complete system to production end-to-end, working with DevOps and various levels of production engineering teams. 5+ years of development experience in end-to-end creation of data pipeline, machine-learning model creation and execution, with core software engineering skills. Core foundational training in Computer Science, rooted in computing theories and computational/programming/data optimization. An undergraduate degree in Computer Science is required, with additional graduate degrees also in CS (not pure science background). We are: We are a leading partner to the world’s major cloud providers. The formation of Accenture Cloud First, with a $3 billion investment over three years, demonstrates our commitment to deliver greater value to our clients when they need it most. Our Cloud First multi-service group of more than 70,000 cloud professionals delivers a full stack of integrated cloud capabilities like data, edge, integrated infrastructure and applications, deep ecosystem skills, culture of change along with pre-configured industry solutions to shape, move, build and operate our clients’ businesses in the cloud. We combine world-class learning and talent development expertise; deep experience in cloud change management; and cloud-ready operating models with a commitment to responsible business by design — with security, data privacy, responsible use of artificial intelligence, sustainability and ethics and compliance built into the fundamental changes Accenture helps companies achieve. You are: As part of our  Data & AI  group, you will lead cloud technology innovation for our clients through robust delivery of world-class data platforms. There will never be a typical day and that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference within exciting client initiatives are unlimited in the ever-changing cloud data landscape. The work: You will be part of a highly collaborative and growing network of cloud data experts, who are taking on today’s biggest, most complex business challenges using the latest data technologies and partnering with the largest cloud providers. We will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. You will have an opportunity to work in roles such as Cloud Data Engineer, Data Modeler or Data Architect covering all aspects of Data including Data Management, Data Governance and Cloud Data Migration. Come grow your career in Technology at Accenture!   What you need: Minimum of 7 years of experience in defining enterprise data strategy in the areas such as cloud data migration, data management, data governance, data supply chain, data security, data archival, data quality, master data management and data architecture for medium to large scale corporations Experience in business development activities such as responding to request for proposals (RFP), structuring solutions, client orals/presentations, drafting statement of work and managing sales pipeline. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience (minimum of 12 years), or an Associate degree with a minimum of 6 years of equivalent work experience. Bonus points if you have: Experience and knowledge of cloud data platforms (such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform and Snowflake) and other data technologies (such as Informatica Certifications in data technologies Speaker at industry conferences presenting latest innovations, models, concepts associated with data practice. As required by the Colorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of minimum compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location.
